post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, May 4
post.Content:
Must....resist....May the 4th.....joke.....enjoy....links! :-)

JavaFX

  • Gerrit Grunwald has posted about writing a JavaFX application in JavaScript, and using the Java Nashorn JavaScript engine to execute it.
  • Ren√© Jahn has posted populating a JavaFX TreeView control with a self-joined table.
  • Mirko Sertic has posted about a JavaFX-based Lua editor (using the WebView node).
  • sencageek has a short post on displaying a POJO in the TreeTableView control.
  • Dejv has posted that version 1.0.1 of ZoomFX has been released.
  • The folks behind yFiles let me know that they've released an updated version of their graphing library for JavaFX.

Have a great week - and may the fourth be with you...dang! :-)
